bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Seems to me, as if something at youtube has changed incompatibly to the version of youtube-dl in Fedora, rendering Fedora's youtube-dl totally dysfunctional:
# youtube-dl https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=.... ... ERROR: Signature extraction failed: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/youtube_dl/extractor/youtube.py", line 1005, in _decrypt_signature video_id, player_url, s File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/youtube_dl/extractor/youtube.py", line 932, in _extract_signature_function cache_res = res(test_string) File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/youtube_dl/extractor/youtube.py", line 984, in <lambda> return lambda s: initial_function([s]) File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/youtube_dl/jsinterp.py", line 254, in resf res, abort = self.interpret_statement(stmt, local_vars) File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/youtube_dl/jsinterp.py", line 55, in interpret_statement v = self.interpret_expression(expr, local_vars, allow_recursion) File "/usr/lib/python3.5/site-packages/youtube_dl/jsinterp.py", line 174, in interpret_expression return obj[member](argvals) KeyError: 'Ai' ...
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): youtube-dl-2016.12.22-1
How reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Try to download an arbitrary video from youtube
Additional info: This seems fixed upstream in youtube-dl-2017.01.10
Confirmed. Maintainers please bump the version when you can since it's the biggest site ;)
youtube-dl-2017.01.10-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-bd8b161195
youtube-dl-2017.01.10-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-0cf46facbe

youtube-dl-2017.01.10-1.el7 has been pushed to the Fedora EPEL 7 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-bd8b161195
